text: Imamiya Ebisu Shrine Affiliation Shinto Deity Kotoshironushi (Ebisu) Imamiya Ebisu Shrine, also known as Imamiya Ebisu jinja, is a Shinto shrine located in Naniwa-ku, Osaka Prefecture, Japan. According to legend, it was established during the reign of Empress Suiko in 600. The shrine's annual festival is held from January 9 to 11. The kami (deities) enshrined at Imamiya Ebisu Shrine include Amaterasu, Kotoshironushi (also known as Ebisu), Susanoo-no-Mikoto, Tsukuyomi-no-Mikoto, and Wakahiru-me. == Related pages == * List of Shinto shrines in Japan == Other websites == * Official website Category:Beppyo shrines Category:G≈ç-sha Category:Pages with unreviewed translations Category:Shinto shrines in Osaka Prefecture Shinto
title: Imamiya Ebisu Shrine
